intro: Vittadinia australis, commonly known as the Australian vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Vittadinia australis is a herbaceous perennial that is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native range.
